member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.AdapterStates
member.summary: Represents the various states of the MTConnect Adapter.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.AdapterStates.Stopped
member.summary: Indicates that the MTConnect Adapter has stopped.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.AdapterStates.Stopping
member.summary: Indicates a transitionary state for the MTConnect Adapter that it is attempting to stop.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.AdapterStates.NotStarted
member.summary: Indicates that the MTConnect Adapter has not initially started.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.AdapterStates.Starting
member.summary: Indicates a transitionary state for the MTConnect Adapter that it is attempting to start.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.AdapterStates.Started
member.summary: Indicates that the MTConnect Adapter has started.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.AdapterStates.Busy
member.summary: Indicates that the MTConnect Adapter is busy with a client.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.ValidationLevel
member.summary: Varying levels of validation message criticalities.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.ValidationLevel.ERROR
member.summary: There is a clear violation against the standard.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.ValidationLevel.WARNING
member.summary: There is a slight violation against the standard that perhaps goes against recommendation.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.ValidationLevel.MESSAGE
member.summary: There is no violation against the standard.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.ValidationLevel.VALID
member.summary: The implementation is indicated as valid.

member.summary: An identifier for known location of the device. For example, this could be a reference to the workstation. The default options set this to the computer name where the adapter is deployed.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IAdapter.HasBegun
member.summary: The send changed has begun and we are tracking conditions.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IAdapter.CanEnqueueDataItems
member.summary:
Flags whether or not the Adapter can store reported DataItem value from its source. The internal queue can ensure that all values reported from the data source are pushed thru the implemented stream.
Setting this to false will automatically send the entire queue thru the stream.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IAdapter.CanValidateDataItems
member.summary: Flags whether or not the Adapter should validate all DataItems before publishing them.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IAdapter.Heartbeat
member.summary: The heartbeat interval (in milliseconds).

member.summary: Indicates what state the MTConnect Adapter is currently in.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IAdapter.Sources
member.summary: An optional reference to an Adapter source. If the Adapter is started with a reference to a source, this is where the reference is maintained.

member.summary: Reference to the options provided in the constructor.

member.summary: A flag for whether or not the has been validated against the MTConnect Standard.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IDataItem.ObservationalType
member.summary: The intended type for the Data Item. See Events, Samples, and Conditions. The type can also be extended according to the standard be adding the prefix x: to indicate an extended type.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IDataItem.ObservationalSubType
member.summary: The intended subType for the Data Item. Refer to the appropriate Events, Samples, and Conditions. The subType can also be extended according to the standard be adding the prefix x: to indicate an extended type.

member.summary: Optional device prefix.

member.summary: Get and set the Value property. This will check if the value has changed and set the changed flag appropriately. Automatically boxes types so will work for any data.

member.summary: Timestamp of when the was last Changed.

member.summary: A flag to indicate if the data item's value has changed since it has last been set.

member.summary: An indicator that this data item must be sent on a separate line. This is done for all data items that are more complex than simple Key|Value pairs.

member.summary: Flag for whether or not this DataItem has a different source for the expected output Timestamp.

member.summary: Forces this to indicate that the has changed.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IDataItem.Begin
member.summary: These methods are mainly for conditions. They allow for mark and sweep of the condition activations.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IDataItem.Prepare
member.summary: This is called before we send the actual changed data. It does the diff from the previous state and finds all the activations that need to be removed. This also check to see if all the activations have been removed because we only need to do a single normal with no native code to clear all. This is not required for simple conditions.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IDataItem.Cleanup
member.summary: Reset the Changed flag.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.Contracts.IDataItem.ItemList(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a list of all the changed data items. Since this is a single value, just return a list with one item if it has changed
member.param: true means to return this data item regardless of the changed flag. This is used to send initial data back to a new client.
